title: Teen kidnapped at gunpoint in Brookings County, authorities say
content:
BROOKINGS (KSFY) - Authorities are investigating after a teen was kidnapped in Brookings County and later found safe in Sioux Falls.
According to the Brookings County Sheriff's Office, the kidnapping happened Tuesday south of Brookings. Assistant Sheriff Scott Sebring says the incident started at a residence, and continued as a car chase. The suspect followed a 17-year-old male and a 23-year-old male until he eventually forced them off the road.
Sebring says the suspect pointed a gun at the two victims, and shot the vehicle they were in. Neither of the two people inside the vehicle were hit. The suspect then struck the 17 year old in a the face with the gun, then forcibly took him from the scene.
The 17-year-old victim was later released at a gas station in central Sioux Falls. Police found the victim and returned him to his parents.
Authorities say the suspect is a 20-year-old man. Warrants for kidnapping and aggravated assault have been issued, though his name has not been released.
The Brookings County Sheriff's Office is investigating the incident.
